020import static java.util.Locale.ROOT;
021import static java.util.regex.Pattern.compile;
022import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants.EMPTY_STRING;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.isNull;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.nonNull;
026import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
027import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNotEmptyArgument;
028import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.isNotEmptyOrBlank;
029import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.splitString;
030import static org.tquadrat.foundation.xml.builder.XMLBuilderUtils.Validator.VALIDATOR_AttributeName;
031import static org.tquadrat.foundation.xml.builder.XMLBuilderUtils.Validator.VALIDATOR_ElementName;
032import static org.tquadrat.foundation.xml.builder.XMLBuilderUtils.Validator.VALIDATOR_NMToken;
033import static org.tquadrat.foundation.xml.builder.XMLBuilderUtils.Validator.VALIDATOR_Prefix;

036import java.io.Serial;

059/**
060 *  A collection of XML related utility methods and factory methods for XML
061 *  elements.
062 *
063 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
064 *  @version $Id: XMLBuilderUtils.java 1071 2023-09-30 01:49:32Z tquadrat $
065 *  @since 0.0.5
066 *
067 *  @UMLGraph.link
068 */
069@SuppressWarnings( "ClassWithTooManyMethods" )
070@UtilityClass
071@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: XMLBuilderUtils.java 1071 2023-09-30 01:49:32Z tquadrat $" )
072@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
073public final class XMLBuilderUtils
074{
075        /*---------------*\
076    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
077        \*---------------*/
078    /**
079     *  The (default) validators.
080     *
081     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
082     *  @version $Id: XMLBuilderUtils.java 1071 2023-09-30 01:49:32Z tquadrat $
083     *  @since 0.0.5
084     *
085     *  @UMLGraph.link
086     */
087    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: XMLBuilderUtils.java 1071 2023-09-30 01:49:32Z tquadrat $" )
088    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
089    public enum Validator
090    {
091            /*------------------*\
092        ====** Enum Declaration **=============================================
093            \*------------------*/
094        /**
095         *  The attribute name validator.
096         */
097        @SuppressWarnings( "synthetic-access" )
098        VALIDATOR_AttributeName( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidAttributeName, XMLBuilderUtils::getAttributeNameValidator ),
099
100        /**
101         *  The element name validator.
102         */
103        @SuppressWarnings( "synthetic-access" )
104        VALIDATOR_ElementName( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidElementName, XMLBuilderUtils::getElementNameValidator ),
105
106        /**
107         *  The nmtoken validator.
108         */
109        @SuppressWarnings( "synthetic-access" )
110        VALIDATOR_NMToken( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidNMToken, XMLBuilderUtils::getNMTokenValidator ),
111
112        /**
113         *  The namespace prefix validator.
114         */
115        @SuppressWarnings( "synthetic-access" )
116        VALIDATOR_Prefix( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidPrefix, XMLBuilderUtils::getPrefixValidator );
117
118            /*------------*\
119        ====** Attributes **===================================================
120            \*------------*/
121        /**
122         *  The method that retrieves the current validator.
123         */
124        @SuppressWarnings( {"NonFinalFieldInEnum", "FieldMayBeFinal"} )
125        private Supplier<? extends Predicate<CharSequence>> m_CurrentValidatorSupplier;
126
127        /**
128         *  The default validator.
129         */
130        @SuppressWarnings( {"FieldMayBeFinal", "NonFinalFieldInEnum"} )
131        private Predicate<CharSequence> m_DefaultValidator;
132
133            /*--------------*\
134        ====** Constructors **=================================================
135            \*--------------*/
136        /**
137         *  Creates a new {@code Validator} instance.
138         *
139         *  @param  defaultValidator    The default validator.
140         *  @param  currentValidatorSupplier    The method that retrieves the
141         *      current validator.
142         */
143        private Validator( final Predicate<CharSequence> defaultValidator, final Supplier<? extends Predicate<CharSequence>> currentValidatorSupplier )
144        {
145            m_CurrentValidatorSupplier = currentValidatorSupplier;
146            m_DefaultValidator = defaultValidator;
147        }   //  Validator()
148
149            /*---------*\
150        ====** Methods **======================================================
151            \*---------*/
152        /**
153         *  Returns the current validator.
154         *
155         *  @return The current validator.
156         */
157        public final Predicate<CharSequence> getCurrent() { return m_CurrentValidatorSupplier.get(); }
158
159        /**
160         *  Returns the default validator.
161         *
162         *  @return The default validator.
163         */
164        @SuppressWarnings( "SuspiciousGetterSetter" )
165        public final Predicate<CharSequence> getDefault() { return m_DefaultValidator; }
166    }
167    //  enum Validator
168
169    /**
170     *  The
171     *  {@link EventObject}
172     *  for changes to the validator configuration.
173     *
174     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
175     *  @version $Id: XMLBuilderUtils.java 1071 2023-09-30 01:49:32Z tquadrat $
176     *  @since 0.0.5
177     *
178     *  @UMLGraph.link
179     */
180    @SuppressWarnings( "PublicInnerClass" )
181    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: XMLBuilderUtils.java 1071 2023-09-30 01:49:32Z tquadrat $" )
182    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
183    public static class ValidatorChangeEvent extends EventObject
184    {
185            /*------------------------*\
186        ====** Static Initialisations **=======================================
187            \*------------------------*/
188        /**
189         *  The serial version UID for objects of this class: {@value}.
190         *
191         *  @hidden
192         */
193        @Serial
194        private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
195
196            /*------------*\
197        ====** Attributes **===================================================
198            \*------------*/
199        /**
200         *  The new validator.
201         */
202        private final Predicate<CharSequence> m_NewValidator;
203
204        /**
205         *  The previous validator.
206         */
207        private final Predicate<CharSequence> m_OldValidator;
208
209        /**
210         *  The validator that changed.
211         */
212        private final Validator m_Validator;
213
214            /*--------------*\
215        ====** Constructors **=================================================
216            \*--------------*/
217        /**
218         *  Creates a new {@code ValidatorChangeEvent} instance.
219         *
220         *  @param  validator   The validator that changed.
221         *  @param  oldValidator    The previous validator.
222         *  @param  newValidator    The new validator.
223         */
224        ValidatorChangeEvent( final Validator validator, final Predicate<CharSequence> oldValidator, final Predicate<CharSequence> newValidator )
225        {
226            super( requireNonNullArgument( validator, "validator" ) );
227            m_Validator = validator;
228            m_OldValidator = oldValidator;
229            m_NewValidator = newValidator;
230        }   //  ValidatorChangeEvent()
231
232            /*---------*\
233        ====** Methods **======================================================
234            \*---------*/
235        /**
236         *  Returns the new validator.
237         *
238         *  @return The new validator.
239         */
240        public final Predicate<CharSequence> getNewValidator() { return m_NewValidator; }
241
242        /**
243         *  Returns the previous validator.
244         *
245         *  @return The old validator.
246         */
247        public final Predicate<CharSequence> getOldValidator() { return m_OldValidator; }
248
249        /**
250         *  Gets the validator that was changed.
251         *
252         *  @return The changed validator.
253         */
254        public final Validator getValidator() { return m_Validator; }
255    }
256    //  class ValidatorChangeEvent
257
258    /**
259     *  The interface for listeners to
260     *  {@link ValidatorChangeEvent}s
261     *
262     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
263     *  @version $Id: XMLBuilderUtils.java 1071 2023-09-30 01:49:32Z tquadrat $
264     *  @since 0.0.5
265     *
266     *  @UMLGraph.link
267     */
268    @FunctionalInterface
269    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: XMLBuilderUtils.java 1071 2023-09-30 01:49:32Z tquadrat $" )
270    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
271    public static interface ValidatorChangeListener
272    {
273            /*---------*\
274        ====** Methods **======================================================
275            \*---------*/
276        /**
277         *  This method gets called each time a validator changes.
278         *
279         *  @param  event   The change event.
280         */
281        @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
282        public void validatorChanged( final ValidatorChangeEvent event );
283    }
284    //  interface ValidatorChangeListener
285
286        /*-----------*\
287    ====** Constants **========================================================
288        \*-----------*/
289    /**
290     *  The regular expression for a valid start character of an XML name.
291     *  Usually, the colon (':') is also allowed, but for namespace
292     *  aware parsers, this is used as the separator between the namespace
293     *  prefix and the name itself.
294     */
295    private static final String XML_NAME_FirstChar = """
296        A-Z_a-z\
297        \\u00C0-\\u00D6\\u00D8-\\u00F6\\u00F8-\\u02FF\\u0370-\\u037D\
298        \\u037F-\\u1FFF\\u200C-\\u200D\\u2070-\\u218F\\u2C00-\\u2FEF\
299        \\u3001-\\uD7FF\\uF900-\\uFDCF\\uFDF0-\\uFFFD\\x{10000}-\\x{EFFFF}""";
300
301    /**
302     *  The regular expression for a character that is valid for an XML after
303     *  the first character. Usually, the colon (':') is also allowed, but for
304     *  namespace aware parsers, this is used as the separator between the
305     *  namespace prefix and the name itself.
306     */
307    @SuppressWarnings( "ConstantExpression" )
308    private static final String XML_NAME_OtherChar = "-"
309        + XML_NAME_FirstChar
310        + ".0-9\\u00B7\\u0300-\\u036F\\u203F-\\u2040";
311
312        /*------------*\
313    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
314        \*------------*/
315    /**
316     *  The validator change listeners.
317     */
318    @SuppressWarnings( "StaticCollection" )
319    private static final Collection<WeakReference<ValidatorChangeListener>> m_ValidatorChangeListeners = new ArrayList<>();
320
321        /*------------------------*\
322    ====** Static Initialisations **===========================================
323        \*------------------------*/
324    /**
325     *  The method that validates an XML attribute name.
326     */
327    private static final AtomicReference<Predicate<CharSequence>> m_AttributeNameValidator = new AtomicReference<>( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidAttributeName );
328
329    /**
330     *  The method that validates an XML element name.
331     */
332    private static final AtomicReference<Predicate<CharSequence>> m_ElementNameValidator = new AtomicReference<>( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidElementName );
333
334    /**
335     *  The pattern that is used to validate a nmtoken.
336     */
337    private static final Pattern m_NMTokenPattern;
338
339    /**
340     *  The method that validates an XML nmtoken.
341     */
342    private static final AtomicReference<Predicate<CharSequence>> m_NMTokenValidator =  new AtomicReference<>( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidNMToken );
343
344    /**
345     *  The method that validates an XML namespace prefix.
346     */
347    private static final AtomicReference<Predicate<CharSequence>> m_PrefixValidator =  new AtomicReference<>( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidPrefix );
348
349    /**
350     *  The pattern that is used to validate an XML name.
351     */
352    private static final Pattern m_XMLNamePattern;
353
354    static
355    {
356        //---* Defines the patterns for the validation *-----------------------
357        try
358        {
359            //noinspection RegExpUnnecessaryNonCapturingGroup,ConstantExpression
360            m_NMTokenPattern = compile( "(?:[" + XML_NAME_FirstChar + "])(?:[" + XML_NAME_OtherChar + ":])*" );
361            //noinspection RegExpUnnecessaryNonCapturingGroup,ConstantExpression
362            m_XMLNamePattern = compile( "(?:[" + XML_NAME_FirstChar + "])(?:[" + XML_NAME_OtherChar + "])*" );
363        }
364        catch( final PatternSyntaxException e )
365        {
366            throw new ExceptionInInitializerError( e );
367        }
368    }
369
370        /*--------------*\
371    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
372        \*--------------*/
373    /**
374     *  No instance allowed for this class.
375     */
376    private XMLBuilderUtils() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( XMLBuilderUtils.class ); }
377
378        /*---------*\
379    ====** Methods **==========================================================
380        \*---------*/
381    /**
382     *  Adds a validator change listener.
383     *
384     *  @param  listener    The listener.
385     */
386    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
387    public static final void addValidatorChangeListener( final ValidatorChangeListener listener )
388    {
389        final var reference = new WeakReference<>( requireNonNullArgument( listener, "listener" ) );
390        synchronized( m_ValidatorChangeListeners )
391        {
392            m_ValidatorChangeListeners.add( reference );
393        }
394    }   //  addValidatorChangeListener()
395
396    /**
397     *  Composes the
398     *  {@link ProcessingInstruction}
399     *  for the XML file header.
400     *
401     *  @param  encoding    The encoding for the resulting document.
402     *  @param  standalone  {@code true} if the XML document is standalone,
403     *      {@code false} if not.
404     *  @return The new processing instruction.
405     */
406    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
407    public static final ProcessingInstruction composeXMLHeader( final Charset encoding, final boolean standalone )
408    {
409        final var retValue = new ProcessingInstructionImpl();
410        retValue.setAttribute( "version", "1.0" );
411        retValue.setAttribute( "encoding", requireNonNullArgument( encoding, "encoding" ).name() );
412        retValue.setAttribute( "standalone", standalone ? "yes" : "no" );
413
414        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
415        return retValue;
416    }   //  composeXMLHeader()
417
418    /**
419     *  Creates a
420     *  {@link ProcessingInstruction}.
421     *
422     *  @param  elementName The name for the processing instruction.
423     *  @return The new processing instruction.
424     */
425    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
426    public static final ProcessingInstruction createProcessingInstruction( final String elementName )
427    {
428        final var retValue = new ProcessingInstructionImpl( elementName );
429
430        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
431        return retValue;
432    }   //  createProcessingInstruction()
433
434    /**
435     *  Creates a
436     *  {@link ProcessingInstruction}.
437     *
438     *  @param  parent  The document that owns the new procession instruction.
439     *  @param  elementName The name for the processing instruction.
440     *  @return The new processing instruction.
441     */
442    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
443    public static final ProcessingInstruction createProcessingInstruction( final XMLDocument parent, final String elementName )
444    {
445        final var retValue = createProcessingInstruction( elementName );
446        requireNonNullArgument( parent, "parent" ).addProcessingInstruction( retValue );
447
448        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
449        return retValue;
450    }   //  createProcessingInstruction()
451
452    /**
453     *  Creates a
454     *  {@link ProcessingInstruction}.
455     *
456     *  @param  elementName The name for the processing instruction.
457     *  @param  data    The data for the processing instruction.
458     *  @return The new processing instruction.
459     */
460    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
461    public static final ProcessingInstruction createProcessingInstruction( final String elementName, final CharSequence data )
462    {
463        final var retValue = new ProcessingInstructionImpl( elementName, data );
464
465        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
466        return retValue;
467    }   //  createProcessingInstruction()
468
469    /**
470     *  Creates a
471     *  {@link ProcessingInstruction}.
472     *
473     *  @param  parent  The document that owns the new procession instruction.
474     *  @param  elementName The name for the processing instruction.
475     *  @param  data    The data for the processing instruction.
476     *  @return The new processing instruction.
477     */
478    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
479    public static final ProcessingInstruction createProcessingInstruction( final XMLDocument parent, final String elementName, final CharSequence data )
480    {
481        final var retValue = createProcessingInstruction( elementName, data );
482        requireNonNullArgument( parent, "parent" ).addProcessingInstruction( retValue );
483
484        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
485        return retValue;
486    }   //  createProcessingInstruction()
487
488    /**
489     *  Creates an XML document that will not have an explicit doc type, the
490     *  root element will be {@code <root>}. The encoding is defined as
491     *  UTF-8.<br>
492     *  <br>Basically, this document would have the DTD
493     *  <pre><code>&lt;!ELEMENT root ANY&gt;</code></pre>.<br>
494     *  <br>The root element allows attributes and children, but will not
495     *  validate them. It also allows text.
496     *
497     *  @return The new XML document.
498     */
499    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
500    public static final XMLDocument createXMLDocument() { return new XMLDocumentImpl(); }
501
502    /**
503     *  Creates an XML document that uses the given element name for the root
504     *  element.<br>
505     *  <br>The given element name is validated using the method that is
506     *  provided by
507     *  {@link #getElementNameValidator()}.<br>
508     *  <br>The created root element allows attributes and children, but will
509     *  not validate them. It also allows text.
510     *  {@link #getElementNameValidator()}.
511     *
512     *  @param  elementName The element name.
513     *  @return The new XML document.
514     */
515    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
516    public static final XMLDocument createXMLDocument( final String elementName )
517    {
518        return new XMLDocumentImpl( requireNotEmptyArgument( elementName, "elementName" ) );
519    }   //  createXMLDocument()
520
521    /**
522     *  Creates an XML document that uses the given element for the root
523     *  element.
524     *
525     *  @param  rootElement The root element.
526     *  @return The new XML document.
527     */
528    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
529    public static final XMLDocument createXMLDocument( final XMLElement rootElement )
530    {
531        return createXMLDocument( requireNonNullArgument( rootElement, "rootElement" ), true );
532    }   //  createXMLDocument()
533
534    /**
535     *  Creates an XML document that uses the given element for the root
536     *  element.
537     *
538     *  @param  rootElement The root element.
539     *  @param  standalone  {@code true} for a standalone document,
540     *      {@code false} otherwise.
541     *  @return The new XML document.
542     */
543    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
544    public static final XMLDocument createXMLDocument( final XMLElement rootElement, final boolean standalone )
545    {
546        return new XMLDocumentImpl( requireNonNullArgument( rootElement, "rootElement" ), standalone );
547    }   //  createXMLDocument()
548
549    /**
550     *  Creates an XML document that uses the given element for the root
551     *  element with the given encoding and DTD.
552     *
553     *  @param  rootElement The root element for this document.
554     *  @param  encoding    The encoding for the new XML document.
555     *  @param  name    The name for the DTD.
556     *  @param  uri The URI for the DTD.
557     *  @return The new XML document.
558     */
559    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
560    public static final XMLDocument createXMLDocument( final XMLElement rootElement, final Charset encoding, final String name, final URI uri )
561    {
562        return new XMLDocumentImpl( requireNonNullArgument( rootElement, "rootElement" ), requireNonNullArgument( encoding, "encoding" ), requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" ), requireNonNullArgument( uri, "uri" ) );
563    }   //  createXMLDocument()
564
565    /**
566     *  Creates an XML document that uses the given element for the root
567     *  element with the given encoding and DTD.
568     *
569     *  @param  rootElement The root element for this document.
570     *  @param  encoding    The encoding for the new XML document.
571     *  @param  uri The URI for the DTD.
572     *  @return The new XML document.
573     */
574    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
575    public static final XMLDocument createXMLDocument( final XMLElement rootElement, final Charset encoding, final URI uri )
576    {
577        return new XMLDocumentImpl( requireNonNullArgument( rootElement, "rootElement" ), requireNonNullArgument( encoding, "encoding" ), requireNonNullArgument( uri, "uri" ) );
578    }   //  createXMLDocument()
579
580    /**
581     *  Creates an XML element for the given element name that supports
582     *  attributes, namespaces, children, text, {@code CDATA} and comments.<br>
583     *  <br>The given element name is validated using the method that is
584     *  provided by
585     *  {@link #getElementNameValidator()}.<br>
586     *  <br>The new element allows attributes and children, but will not
587     *  validate them. It also allows text.
588     *
589     *  @param  elementName The element name.
590     *  @return The new XML element.
591     */
592    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
593    public static final XMLElement createXMLElement( final String elementName )
594    {
595        return new XMLElementImpl( requireNotEmptyArgument( elementName, "elementName" ) );
596    }   //  createXMLElement()
597
598    /**
599     *  <p>{@summary Creates an XML element for the given element name that
600     *  supports attributes, namespaces, children, text, {@code CDATA} and
601     *  comments, and add the given text.}</p>
602     *  <p>The given element name is validated using the method that is
603     *  provided by
604     *  {@link #getElementNameValidator()}.</p>
605     *  <p>The new element allows attributes and children, but will not
606     *  validate them. It also allows text (obviously).</p>
607     *
608     *  @param  elementName The element name.
609     *  @param  text    The text for the new element.
610     *  @return The new XML element.
611     */
612    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
613    public static final XMLElement createXMLElement( final String elementName, final CharSequence text )
614    {
615        final XMLElement retValue = new XMLElementImpl( requireNotEmptyArgument( elementName, "elementName" ) );
616        retValue.addText( requireNonNullArgument( text, "text" ) );
617
618        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
619        return retValue;
620    }   //  createXMLElement()
621
622    /**
623     *  Creates an XML element for the given element name that supports
624     *  attributes, namespaces, children, text, {@code CDATA} and comments, and
625     *  adds it as child to the given parent.<br>
626     *  <br>The given element name is validated using the method that is
627     *  provided by
628     *  {@link #getElementNameValidator()}.<br>
629     *  <br>The new element allows attributes and children, but will not
630     *  validate them. It also allows text.
631     *
632     *  @param  elementName The element name.
633     *  @param  parent  The parent element.
634     *  @return The new XML element.
635     */
636    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
637    public static final XMLElement createXMLElement( final String elementName, final XMLElement parent )
638    {
639        final XMLElement retValue = new XMLElementImpl( requireNotEmptyArgument( elementName, "elementName" ) );
640        requireNonNullArgument( parent, "parent" ).addChild( retValue );
641
642        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
643        return retValue;
644    }   //  createXMLElement()
645
646    /**
647     *  Creates an XML element for the given element name that supports
648     *  attributes, namespaces, children, text, {@code CDATA} and comments,
649     *  adds the given text, and adds it as child to the given parent.<br>
650     *  <br>The given element name is validated using the method that is
651     *  provided by
652     *  {@link #getElementNameValidator()}.<br>
653     *  <br>The new element allows attributes and children, but will not
654     *  validate them. It also allows text (obviously).
655     *
656     *  @param  elementName The element name.
657     *  @param  parent  The parent element.
658     *  @param  text    The text for the new element.
659     *  @return The new XML element.
660     */
661    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
662    public static final XMLElement createXMLElement( final String elementName, final XMLElement parent, final CharSequence text )
663    {
664        final XMLElement retValue = new XMLElementImpl( requireNotEmptyArgument( elementName, "elementName" ) );
665        retValue.addText( requireNonNullArgument( text, "text" ) );
666        requireNonNullArgument( parent, "parent" ).addChild( retValue );
667
668        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
669        return retValue;
670    }   //  createXMLElement()
671
672    /**
673     *  Creates an XML element for the given tag and adds it as child to the
674     *  given document.<br>
675     *  <br>The given element name is validated using the method that is
676     *  provided by
677     *  {@link #getElementNameValidator()}.<br>
678     *  <br>The new element allows attributes and children, but will not
679     *  validate them. It also allows text.
680     *
681     *  @param  elementName The element name.
682     *  @param  parent  The document.
683     *  @return The new XML element.
684     */
685    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
686    public static final XMLElement createXMLElement( final String elementName, final XMLDocument parent )
687    {
688        final XMLElement retValue = new XMLElementImpl( requireNotEmptyArgument( elementName, "elementName" ) );
689        requireNonNullArgument( parent, "parent" ).addChild( retValue );
690
691        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
692        return retValue;
693    }   //  createXMLElement()
694
695    /**
696     *  Creates an XML element for the given tag and with the given text, and
697     *  adds it as child to the given document.<br>
698     *  <br>The given element name is validated using the method that is
699     *  provided by
700     *  {@link #getElementNameValidator()}.<br>
701     *  <br>The new element allows attributes and children, but will not
702     *  validate them. It also allows text (obviously).
703     *
704     *  @param  elementName The element name.
705     *  @param  parent  The document.
706     *  @param  text    The text for the new element.
707     *  @return The new XML element.
708     */
709    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
710    public static final XMLElement createXMLElement( final String elementName, final XMLDocument parent, final CharSequence text )
711    {
712        final XMLElement retValue = new XMLElementImpl( requireNotEmptyArgument( elementName, "elementName" ) );
713        retValue.addText( requireNonNullArgument( text, "text" ) );
714        requireNonNullArgument( parent, "parent" ).addChild( retValue );
715
716        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
717        return retValue;
718    }   //  createXMLElement()
719
720    /**
721     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using XML entities.<br>
722     *  <br>For example:<br>
723     *  <br>{@code "bread" & "butter"}<br>
724     *  <br>becomes:<br>
725     *  <br><code>&amp;quot;bread&amp;quot; &amp;amp;
726     *  &amp;quot;butter&amp;quot;</code>.<br>
727     *  <br>Delegates to
728     *  {@link StringUtils#escapeXML(CharSequence)}.
729     *
730     *  @param  input   The {@code String} to escape, may be null.
731     *  @return A new escaped {@code String}, or {@code null} if the
732     *      argument was already {@code null}.
733     *
734     *  @see #unescapeXML(CharSequence)
735     */
736    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
737    public static String escapeXML( final CharSequence input ) { return StringUtils.escapeXML( input ); }
738
739    /**
740     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using XML entities and
741     *  writes them to an
742     *  {@link Appendable}.<br>
743     *  <br>For example:<br>
744     *  <br>{@code "bread" & "butter"}<br>
745     *  <br>becomes:<br>
746     *  <br><code>&amp;quot;bread&amp;quot; &amp;amp;
747     *  &amp;quot;butter&amp;quot;</code>.<br>
748     *  <br>Delegates to
749     *  {@link StringUtils#escapeXML(Appendable,CharSequence)}.
750     *
751     *  @param  appendable  The appendable object receiving the escaped string.
752     *  @param  input   The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.
753     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The appendable is {@code null}.
754     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
755     *      from calls to the
756     *      {@link Appendable#append(char)}
757     *      method.
758     *
759     *  @see #escapeXML(CharSequence)
760     *  @see #unescapeXML(CharSequence)
761     */
762    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
763    public static void escapeXML( final Appendable appendable, final CharSequence input ) throws IOException
764    {
765        StringUtils.escapeXML( appendable, input );
766    }   //  escapeXML()
767
768    /**
769     *  Returns the method to validate attribute names.
770     *
771     *  @return The validator method.
772     */
773    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
774    public static final Predicate<CharSequence> getAttributeNameValidator() { return m_AttributeNameValidator.get(); }
775
776    /**
777     *  Returns the method to validate element names.
778     *
779     *  @return The validator method.
780     */
781    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
782    public static final Predicate<CharSequence> getElementNameValidator() { return m_ElementNameValidator.get(); }
783
784    /**
785     *  Returns the method to validate {@code nmtoken}s.
786     *
787     *  @return The validator method.
788     */
789    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
790    public static final Predicate<CharSequence> getNMTokenValidator() { return m_NMTokenValidator.get(); }
791
792    /**
793     *  Returns the method to validate prefixes.
794     *
795     *  @return The validator method.
796     */
797    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
798    public static final Predicate<CharSequence> getPrefixValidator() { return m_PrefixValidator.get(); }
799
800    /**
801     *  The default implementation for an attribute name validator.
802     *
803     *  @param  attributeName   The name to test.
804     *  @return {@code true} if the given name is valid, {@code false}
805     *  otherwise.
806     *
807     *  @see #getAttributeNameValidator()
808     */
809    private static final boolean isValidAttributeName( final CharSequence attributeName )
810    {
811        var retValue = isNotEmptyOrBlank( attributeName );
812        if( retValue )
813        {
814            var attribute = EMPTY_STRING;
815            final var parts = splitString( attributeName, ':' );
816            switch( parts.length )
817            {
818                //  No namespace prefix.
819                case 1 -> attribute = parts[0];
820                //  Namespace prefix.
821                case 2 ->
822                {
823                    attribute = parts[1];
824                    retValue = getPrefixValidator().test( parts[0] );
825                }
826                // More than one colon
827                default -> retValue = false;
828            }
829            if( retValue && (attribute.length() >= 3) ) retValue = !attribute.toLowerCase( ROOT ).startsWith( "xml" );
830            if( retValue ) retValue = m_XMLNamePattern.matcher( attribute ).matches();
831        }
832
833        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
834        return retValue;
835    }   //  isValidAttributeName()
836
837    /**
838     *  The default implementation for an element name validator.
839     *
840     *  @param  elementName   The name to test.
841     *  @return {@code true} if the given name is valid, {@code false}
842     *  otherwise.
843     *
844     *  @see #getElementNameValidator()
845     */
846    private static final boolean isValidElementName( final CharSequence elementName )
847    {
848        var retValue = isNotEmptyOrBlank( elementName );
849        if( retValue )
850        {
851            var element = EMPTY_STRING;
852            final var parts = splitString( elementName, ':' );
853            switch( parts.length )
854            {
855                //  No namespace prefix.
856                case 1 -> element = parts[0];
857                //  Namespace prefix.
858                case 2 ->
859                {
860                    element = parts[1];
861                    retValue = getPrefixValidator().test( parts[0] );
862                }
863                // More than one colon
864                default -> retValue = false;
865            }
866            if( retValue && (element.length() >= 3) ) retValue = !element.toLowerCase( ROOT ).startsWith( "xml" );
867            if( retValue ) retValue = m_XMLNamePattern.matcher( element ).matches();
868        }
869
870        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
871        return retValue;
872    }   //  isValidElementName()
873
874    /**
875     *  The default implementation for an NMToken validator.
876     *
877     *  @param  nmtoken   The NMToken to test.
878     *  @return {@code true} if the given NMToke is valid, {@code false}
879     *  otherwise.
880     *
881     *  @see #getNMTokenValidator()
882     */
883    private static final boolean isValidNMToken( final CharSequence nmtoken )
884    {
885        var retValue = isNotEmptyOrBlank( nmtoken );
886        if( retValue ) retValue = m_NMTokenPattern.matcher( nmtoken ).matches();
887
888        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
889        return retValue;
890    }   //  isValidNMToken()
891
892    /**
893     *  The default implementation for a prefix validator.
894     *
895     *  @param  prefix  The prefix to test.
896     *  @return {@code true} if the given prefix is valid, {@code false}
897     *  otherwise.
898     *
899     *  @see #getPrefixValidator()
900     */
901    private static final boolean isValidPrefix( final CharSequence prefix )
902    {
903        var retValue = isNotEmptyOrBlank( prefix );
904        if( retValue ) retValue = m_XMLNamePattern.matcher( prefix ).matches();
905
906        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
907        return retValue;
908    }   //  isValidPrefix()
909
910    /**
911     *  Removes the given validator change listener.
912     *
913     *  @param  listener    The listener to remove.
914     */
915    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
916    public static final void removeValidatorChangeListener( final ValidatorChangeListener listener )
917    {
918        if( nonNull( listener ) )
919        {
920            synchronized( m_ValidatorChangeListeners )
921            {
922                var removed = false;
923                for( final var reference : m_ValidatorChangeListeners )
924                {
925                    final var current = reference.get();
926                    if( isNull( current ) )
927                    {
928                        removed = true;
929                    }
930                    else if( current == listener )
931                    {
932                        reference.clear();
933                        removed = true;
934                    }
935                }
936
937                //---* Housekeeping: get rid of the dead references *----------
938                if( removed ) m_ValidatorChangeListeners.removeIf( r -> isNull( r.get() ) );
939            }
940        }
941    }   //  removeValidatorChangeListener()
942
943    /**
944     *  Sets the validators back to the default configuration. The current
945     *  validators are abandoned.
946     *
947     *  @see #getAttributeNameValidator()
948     *  @see #getElementNameValidator()
949     *  @see #getNMTokenValidator()
950     *  @see #getPrefixValidator()
951     *  @see #setAttributeNameValidator(Predicate)
952     *  @see #setElementNameValidator(Predicate)
953     *  @see #setNMTokenValidator(Predicate)
954     *  @see #setPrefixValidator(Predicate)
955     */
956    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
957    public static final void restoreDefaultValidators()
958    {
959        //---* Set the validator methods *-------------------------------------
960        setAttributeNameValidator( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidAttributeName );
961        setElementNameValidator( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidElementName );
962        setNMTokenValidator( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidNMToken );
963        setPrefixValidator( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidPrefix );
964    }   //  restoreDefaultValidators()
965
966    /**
967     *  Sets the method to validate attribute names.
968     *
969     *  @param  validator The validator method.
970     */
971    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
972    public static final void setAttributeNameValidator( final Predicate<CharSequence> validator )
973    {
974        final var oldValidator = m_AttributeNameValidator.getAndSet( requireNonNullArgument( validator, "validator" ) );
975        synchronized( m_ValidatorChangeListeners )
976        {
977            if( !m_ValidatorChangeListeners.isEmpty() )
978            {
979                final var event = new ValidatorChangeEvent( VALIDATOR_AttributeName, oldValidator, validator );
980                for( final var reference : m_ValidatorChangeListeners )
981                {
982                    final var listener = reference.get();
983                    if( nonNull( listener ) ) listener.validatorChanged( event );
984                }
985            }
986        }
987    }   //  setAttributeNameValidator()
988
989    /**
990     *  Sets the method to validate element names.
991     *
992     *  @param  validator The validator method.
993     */
994    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
995    public static final void setElementNameValidator( final Predicate<CharSequence> validator )
996    {
997        final var oldValidator = m_ElementNameValidator.getAndSet( requireNonNullArgument( validator, "validator" ) );
998        synchronized( m_ValidatorChangeListeners )
999        {
1000            if( !m_ValidatorChangeListeners.isEmpty() )
1001            {
1002                final var event = new ValidatorChangeEvent( VALIDATOR_ElementName, oldValidator, validator );
1003                for( final var reference : m_ValidatorChangeListeners )
1004                {
1005                    final var listener = reference.get();
1006                    if( nonNull( listener ) ) listener.validatorChanged( event );
1007                }
1008            }
1009        }
1010    }   //  setElementNameValidator()
1011
1012    /**
1013     *  Sets the method to validate {@code nmtoken}s.
1014     *
1015     *  @param  validator The validator method.
1016     */
1017    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1018    public static final void setNMTokenValidator( final Predicate<CharSequence> validator )
1019    {
1020        final var oldValidator = m_NMTokenValidator.getAndSet( requireNonNullArgument( validator, "validator" ) );
1021        synchronized( m_ValidatorChangeListeners )
1022        {
1023            if( !m_ValidatorChangeListeners.isEmpty() )
1024            {
1025                final var event = new ValidatorChangeEvent( VALIDATOR_NMToken, oldValidator, validator );
1026                for( final var reference : m_ValidatorChangeListeners )
1027                {
1028                    final var listener = reference.get();
1029                    if( nonNull( listener ) ) listener.validatorChanged( event );
1030                }
1031            }
1032        }
1033    }   //  setNMTokenValidator()
1034
1035    /**
1036     *  Sets the method to validate prefixes.
1037     *
1038     *  @param  validator The validator method.
1039     */
1040    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1041    public static final void setPrefixValidator( final Predicate<CharSequence> validator )
1042    {
1043        final var oldValidator = m_PrefixValidator.getAndSet( requireNonNullArgument( validator, "validator" ) );
1044        synchronized( m_ValidatorChangeListeners )
1045        {
1046            if( !m_ValidatorChangeListeners.isEmpty() )
1047            {
1048                final var event = new ValidatorChangeEvent( VALIDATOR_Prefix, oldValidator, validator );
1049                for( final var reference : m_ValidatorChangeListeners )
1050                {
1051                    final var listener = reference.get();
1052                    if( nonNull( listener ) ) listener.validatorChanged( event );
1053                }
1054            }
1055        }
1056    }   //  setPrefixValidator()
1057
1058    /**
1059     *  <p>{@summary Strips HTML or XML comments from the given String.}</p>
1060     *  <p>Delegates to
1061     *  {@link StringUtils#stripXMLComments(CharSequence)}.</p>
1062     *
1063     *  @param  input   The HTML/XML string.
1064     *  @return The string without the comments.
1065     */
1066    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1067    public static final String stripXMLComments( final CharSequence input ) { return StringUtils.stripXMLComments( input ); }
1068
1069    /**
1070     *  Unescapes an XML string containing XML entity escapes to a string
1071     *  containing the actual Unicode characters corresponding to the
1072     *  escapes.<br>
1073     *  <br>If an entity is unrecognised, it is left alone, and inserted
1074     *  verbatim into the result string. e.g. &quot;&amp;gt;&amp;zzzz;x&quot;
1075     *  will become &quot;&gt;&amp;zzzz;x&quot;.<br>
1076     *  <br>Delegates to
1077     *  {@link StringUtils#unescapeXML(CharSequence)}.
1078     *
1079     *  @param  input The {@code String} to unescape, may be {@code null}.
1080     *  @return A new unescaped {@code String}, {@code null} if the given
1081     *      string was already {@code null}.
1082     *
1083     *  @see #escapeXML(CharSequence)
1084     *  @see #escapeXML(Appendable,CharSequence)
1085     */
1086    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1087    public static final String unescapeXML( final CharSequence input ) { return StringUtils.unescapeXML( input ); }
1088
1089    /**
1090     *  Unescapes an XML String containing XML entity escapes to a String
1091     *  containing the actual Unicode characters corresponding to the escapes
1092     *  and writes it to the given
1093     *  {@link Appendable}.<br>
1094     *  <br>If an entity is unrecognised, it is left alone, and inserted
1095     *  verbatim into the result string. e.g. &quot;&amp;gt;&amp;zzzz;x&quot;
1096     *  will become &quot;&gt;&amp;zzzz;x&quot;.<br>
1097     *  <br>Delegates to
1098     *  {@link StringUtils#unescapeXML(Appendable,CharSequence)}.
1099     *
1100     *  @param  appendable  The appendable receiving the unescaped string.
1101     *  @param  input The {@code String} to unescape, may be {@code null}.
1102     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The writer is {@code null}.
1103     *  @throws IOException An IOException occurred.
1104     *
1105     *  @see #escapeXML(CharSequence)
1106     */
1107    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1108    public static final void unescapeXML( final Appendable appendable, final CharSequence input ) throws IOException
1109    {
1110        StringUtils.unescapeXML( appendable, input );
1111    }   //  unescapeXML()
1112}
1113//  class XMLBuilderUtils
